text: 750ml growler @ Alexs. Pours a cloudy golden colour with a thin white head. Nose is sweet, fruity, with some dank hop notes. Flavour is pithy, tongue tingling pith bitterness, while fruit and mildly sweet.

750ml growler (thx, Jonathan J.!). Growlered on 2016-04-01. Pours a cloudy blond with a white head. Aroma is dank, tropical fruits. Taste is similar. This one is quite similar to the beers which Twin Sails, Boombox or Superflux brew in BC. Maybe it is just a little bit better balanced than the beers of the mentioned breweries, which is not a surprise taking into account for how long HF brews this. It is definitely not something from the next level of brewing, since, for example, Superflux Colour and Shape b1 and b4 maybe taste even better.
Courtesy of SergeyCloudy to murky blond color, medium head. Fruity aroma, very zesty. Lean body, not too sweet, with delicate pale malts, bitter zest character, a bit chalky in the final.Very good.

Bottle, from and with Alexandre Serre et Hugue Lebel (merci!), savoured on August 6 2016; eye: orangey, hazy, sheet of white head, slight lacing; nose: malt, tangerine, residual sugar, citrus fruits; mouth: malt, tangerine, residual sugar, citrus fruits, finale in citrus fruits with presence of malt-caramel, medium body, average carbonation, mildly sweet, lightly fleshy texture; overall: correct

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille, de et avec Alexandre Serre et Hugue Lebel (merci!), savourée le 6 août 2016; il : orangée, trouble, couverture de mousse blanche, très légère dentelle; nez : malt, tangerine, sucre résiduel, agrumes; bouche : malt, tangerine, sucre résiduel, agrumes, finale en agrumes avec présence de malt-caramel, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture légèrement charnue; en résumé : correct

Tap at fools gold walking by and had to pop in. Lighter cloudy orangy yellow pour smallish head. Nose is. Ive citrus and some florals. Tastes of grapefruit, mango, floral, grassy light dough. Zippy palate. Very refreshing.

Fresh 750ml swing-top bottle purchased at the brewery, cloudy blonde hue, with a frothy bubbly white head, with a nice fruity yeasty, doughy, lemon rind nose, with some lemon pie, floral citrus, leafy, grassy, light tropical fruit hop accents, and some citrus rind, faint tropical fruit, lemon, pineapple, subtle lemon pie crust, lemongrass notes in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a very good fruity flowery citrus, leafy, grassy, minty, tropical fruit hoppy character, with some yeasty, zesty lemon, grapefruit peel, lemon pie, subtle lemongrass, mint leaf, fruity yeast, doughy, subtle panettone cake dough flavours, leading towards a fruity citrus rind, fruity yeastiness, lingering citrus, leafy, grassy hop bitterness finish.

Draught. Pours a cloudy straw-orange color - reminiscent of grapefruit juice - with a large foamy white head. Aroma is floral hops, grapefruit, mango, and pineapple. Big grapefruit taste with caramel malt, bread, and some pine. Strong bitter finish. Full body. Medium carbonation. Heavy, bready, creamy mouth feel.

Pours an orange, hazed color with a decent, bubbly white head.

Smells of a pleasant tropical crispness, defined by orange pulp, tangerine and lemon zest, topped off by a chunk of juicy blood orange and pineapple. Cakey malts, white bread crust and wet grass, together with a note of blueberry bush build up the subtle malt balance in this, creating a nose which comes very well together.

Drinks silk, incredibly soft with a nice, juice accompanied hop bite, which gets wrapped up by toffee malts with a prevailing, long lasting dryness on the tongue. Drinks very gentle with no indication of the higher abv apart from the noteable malt backbone during the finish.

Tastes of a nice lemon crispness, which gets a fruity quality due to fresh peeled oranges and wet grass with an immediate dry bite. The hop bite gets tamed by the fluffy, soft mouthfeel and bready malts, which turn cakey sweet during the mid palate. Develops a prickly kiwi sourness during the finish, soothed by blood orange and juicy, dry lemon with an ongoing, supportive malt foundation.

Not overly complex but well brewed with an awesomly soft mouthfeel and a pungent, well nuanced hop punch.

Thus far a top 3 IPA Ive ever had. Thanks a ton Adamchandler. Pours a solid peach colour. Light foamy head with lacing. Big citrus all over the place. Aromas of grapefruit, grapefruit rind, tropical fruit. Similar flavours. Great citrus bitterness and sweetness. I literally feel like Im drinking liquified citrus rind. Stunning.

Tap at Bridgview Tavern, Tarrytown, NY. Pours hazy golden, with fluffy white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit, grapefruit rind. Taste is light tropical fruit, citrus forward, faint bitter grapefruit rind. Slight malty cracker and a slightly sweet honey finish. Above average bitterness, clean, smooth mouthfeel. Solid beer.

Draft sample at the source. The beer is a cleqr gold with a white head of foam. Great head retention. The aroma has citrusy and earthy pine notes. Some vanilla peaks through. Finishes dry and juicy. Medium and soft carbonation. Really nice.

750ml growler fill on site consumed 2 days later. Pours a dark orange almost burnt, very hazy, with a nice off white thinly foamed head with proper lacing. Smells of hops, a bit of malts and citrusy grapefruit. Great bitter taste of grapefruit immediately and then other citrus, floral and earthy hoppy backbone. Drinks super easy and smooth with a nice full mouthfeel. Another hit by Hill Farmstead. Way to go.

From the growler filled on August 20, 2016. The pour is a milky looking pale yellow-orange under a white moderate head. Spice, herbs, and grapefruit round out the aromas along with a white bread malt base. Medium to full body. This has the tartness of grapefruit but the flavor tends to bring out the herbal characters more with the same malt sweetness underneath. Bitter finish. No booze.

So good! Growler from brewery. Pours hazy light orange with lots of foamy head and tons of lacing. Nose is grapefruit. Flavours of grapefruit, some light pine, some mango. Light bready notes. Taste is medium bitter, light juicy sweet. Full sticky body with lively carbonation. Incredibly drinkable for the abv, no hint of the hidden power.

Bouteille 750 ml. Couleur jaune pailel voilée, mousse blanche crémeuse et abondante. Arôme de fruits exotiques, agrumes et spécifiquement pamplemousse. En bouche, soyeuse, fruitée, houblonnée, amertume moyenne qui sétend. Le malt qui fait sa job de mettre le houblon en valeur. Belle texture en bouche, elle est douce mais puissante en même temps. Des notes de pamplemousse certes, mais aussi des mangues, fruits jaunes et ananas. Finale en fruits tropicaux, amertume douce et houblon frais. Excellente. wow.
On tap at Pony Bar. Hazy golden, white head. Huge grapefruit, grass, citrus mango, pissy hop. Flavor is juicy grapefruit, citrus, grass, biscuit. So stupidly good.
From notes (Jan 2016). Grapefruit and malt with a big orange finish. Magnificent.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Light hazy dark golden pour with a generous head. Notes of juicy hops, pine needles, tons of grapefruit, apricots, smooth. Really good!

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours hazy dark yellow with a white head. Aroma is very tropical with dank hops, orange, citrus, mango, pineapple and quite juicy overall. The taste is juicy and extremely fresh with notes of tropical fruits, dank hops, mild pineapple and hop juice basically. Very well made and awesome!

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy golden pale orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity peachy hoppy grapefruit bitter aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit peachy flavor. Has a fruity malty piney grapefruit hoppy bitter peachy finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of light dankness, fresh hops, citrus, floral, sweetness, malts, orange. Taste is herbal, dank, citrussy, light malty, grassy, orange, mandarin.
Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter wonderfull flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Very nice.

From Tap: golden unclear, thick white head, soft hop aroma, fruity, grapefruit, mango, medium sweetness, fruitbasket-taste, gentle bitterness, taste of alkohol, soft carbonation, silky milky mouthfeel, some pine, spice, very nice hoppy-fruity taste, too much alkohol in taste

Look; off white head, hazy yellow golden body.
Aroma; fresh citrus, mandarin, pale malts. 
Taste; fruits, mandarines, nectarines, caramel, light malts, sugar -
and finishes fruity bitter. 
Palate; solid enough. 
Overall; a very fruity fruit bowl. Abv completely hidden.

Drucken på fat på Mikkeller&Friends. Stor humle doft med mango och grape främst. Lite större kropp och lite sötare annars inte jättelångt ifrån Susan som ändå är snäppet bättre. En riktigt bra DIPA. Lång eftersmak.

Tap at mikkeller and friends, copenhagen. Hazy orange color, white head. Just perfect aroma has lots of fruits, mango, grapefruit, hops. Balanced taste, hops, fruits, grapefruit, dry end. Nearly perfect ipa.
Aroma is clean grapefruit and citrus. Hazy yellow with White head. Taste is light sweetness and hevy bitterness. Medium body medium carbonation, finish is a pleasant dryness.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar Copenhagen. Low fluffy white lasting head. Hazy yellow body. Odd vedgetable grapefruit aroma and flavor with spicy notes. Fair amount of hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish.

Draught. Amber coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Aroma. Tropical fruits, flowers, sweetness, citrus, flavour. Trop fruits. Sweetness, citrus, sweetness, herbs. Med ito full bodied. Ends flowery bitter. Nice one.

Tasted on 4/13/16 from a 750mL swing top growler, big thanks to Drews for sharing. Pours hazy, light orange with a thick white head that slowly recedes to spotty lace. The nose is a bit of dankness with a ton of sweeter guava, orange, and mango hops, just a bit of caramel bread aroma. The flavor is balanced and dry, with the tropical hops giving a perception of sweetness, grapefruit zest bitterness, and just a bit of malty bread on the back. The body is medium and somewhat oily, with average carbonation, and a long lightly bitter and tropical fruit finish.

On tap at Mikkeller. Pours quite hazy golden with a dense white head. Loads of tropical fruity aroma notes. Pineapple and peaches. Grapefruit and passion fruit in the flavor. Pineapple and unripe peach. Great juicy feel. Wow!

From tap at Mikkeller Bar. Hazy golden to orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, malt, peach, grapefruit, citrus and bitterness.

Tap @Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade. Pours murky yellow with a small, staying creamy white head. Aroma has fresh hops, grass, grapefruit, citrus, crisp malts. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good malty sweetness, crisp and light bready, peach, grass, grapefruit. Solid lingering bitterness. Truly well-balanced.

08-APR-2016, draft @Mikkeller & Friends, side-by-side with Double Citra. Hazy, Golden with a huge, lasting. laicng, foamy, White head. Aroma is citrus, grape fruit, flowers, perfume, peach and a Little more malt than in Double Citra.. Taste the same with a touch of petrol. A Little better than Double Citra. Perhaps rated a bit too high, but I am a sucker for hype:-)
Very fresh for an IIPA.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Victoriagade. Cloudy golden colour with a medium sized, white head. Fruity aroma with citrus fruits, pale malts, grasses, peaches, caramel malts and a slight herbal note. Taste is bitter. Medium to full body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits and floral hops. Lovely IIPA.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2016 Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma is grapes, red fruit, flowery, some perfume hops and some caramel. Hazy amber with white head, lasting. Moderate bitterness, light sweetness, some kind of hoppy sweet taste. Full body, smooth texture, light carb., long flowery bitter finish.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma of fruits, hops, grass, spices a bit basement aromas. Taste of grapefruit, grass, bitter with sweet aftertaste and dry finish. Medium body and soft carbonation.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy golden colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of citrus and grapefruits with notes of caramel.
Fruity flavor of caramel and citrus with notes of grapefruits.
Hoppy finish.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Kegged 22nd of march, so less than three weeks old. Pours a hazy yellowish orange with a medium sized, long lasting, white head. Aroma has tons of orange, sweet orange, orange peel, grape fruit, sweet malts, and then some weird minty, hemp hand lotion smelling hops (i guess). Taste is pretty sweet, juicy fruity, minty fresh and barely no bitterness. Average carbonation and an oily body. Gotta admit that i wonder how this made to top 50 though.

Hazy light orange pour. The nose has soft piney hops and lots of them. 
On the palate the soft hoppy notes are back, with more light pine sap and soft fruits. Perfect mouthfeel. Aftertaste is perfectly piney rich with good bitterness. Well made AF

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade. Pours hazy deep golden with a creamy slightly off-white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical juice, grapefruit, pineapple, mango, oranges and peach. Taste is medium+ bitter and medium+ sweet. Full bodied, oily texture, average carbonation. Finish well-balanced bitterness and very juicy.

fra fad 
duft: juice frisk 
smag: super frisk juice en smule bitter frisk appelsin lime let drikkelig
On tap at Mikkeller bar barcelona. Hazy amber colour with white head. Resinous and tropical fruits aroma. Juicy, tropical fruits, sweet, resinous taste. Medium body. Close to perfection.

Tap. Hazy, deep golden with a small, lacing off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit, peach, pine and tropical fruit notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and bitter. Medium bodied, fat oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent DIPA. 🌟🌟🌟🌟
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and grapefruity. Peachy, citrusy and grapefruity. Mild pine. Solid hoppy. Peachy and lingering grapefruity. Smooth fruity finish.

(Tap at Mikkeller Bar Aarhus)
An amber, nearly full-bodied, ale, with a wonderfully hoppy aroma and flavour including both citrus and pine character. A full malt base and some residual sweetness balances the hops and the bitterness very well. One of the best IPAs I have had. Only 16 days old, and it shows.

Keg. Hazy/unclear golden, medium sized white head. Honey, citrus, flowers, light candy, white bread, sugar. Medium body, oily texture, medium sweet and bitter. Rough bitter finish. Sweet and soft at first, then turns rough.

(20 cl on tap @ Mikkeller Bar) Poured at fridge temperature into a Mikkeller signature glass reveals a cloudy golden body with what could easily be two fingers of creamy, white head that shows good retention and leaves beautiful lace. Good regeneration. Initial aroma seems to bring out citra-like hop notes but as it warms I get more lime, which could be Motueka. Further along it gets a bit more resiny. Either way it is - as always - a harmonious blend that brings tropical fruit juice to mind in a good way. Pretty gentle on the palate. Bitterness is marvellously subdued for the style - just lingering as a driness on the palate. The booze kind of shows its fangs ever so slightly on the sides but considering that its 8 pct ABV and with very little residual sweetness its quite impressive how its been integrated in the juice. Society and Solitude is an apt name for this glass that I enjoy standing on my own in the Mikkeller Bar, while the rest of the Copenhagen craft beer society is standing in the bar for another round of Hill Farmstead. In terms of drinkability this one rivals Three Floyds Dreadnaught although its probably a bit more on the left in the jammy vs watery spectrum.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus.Unclear dark yellow/orange will small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, tropical fruit, peach, hop and earthy. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, tropical fruit, pineapple, earthy, grapefruit, citrus, medium sweet and medium bitter.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head, light lacings. Aroma of malt, grass, tropical fruit, peach, mango, kiwi, citrus, grapefruit. Flavor is malt, grassy hops, tropical fruit, sweet fruity hops, citrus, grapefruit, light alcohol. Medium to full body, average carbonation, dry and lasting bitter finish. 070416

Draft. An unclear golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of lemons, hops, malt, and spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, hops, spices, and malt, leading to a bitter finish. Very fresh.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Unclear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and rather hoppy - fruity. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 070416
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are nice bitter hops, fruits, flowers, malt and has a nice bitter fruity finish.

July 16, 2015. On tap at Three Penny Taproom. #2700.
Cloudy yellow with a small creamy white head. Aroma is very fruity with lots of grapefruits, also some orange and pineapple notes, resin, grass and pine. Taste is rounded medium bitterness, light sweet. Finish is smooth grassy, piney and grapefruit pith bitterness, sweet notes of grain and tropical fruits. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, rounded mouthfeel with a slight dry finish. 
Amazing!
Pours hazy glowing golden orange with white head. Smell is tropical fruit, pine, and mango. Taste is juicy wet tropical hops, pine, mango and citrus. Light body meidum carb. Silky mouth feel.

On tap at Hill Farmstead. An unclear, yellow-colored beer with a small, dense, white head. Grapefruit, pine cones and resins in the aroma, some citrus zest too, but not much maltyness. The same goes for the flavor, its bitter, with lots of grapefruit and pine cones, leaving the pale malts in the back. Its dry and nicely carbonated with a long, bitter and grapefruity finish. Quenching and tasteful, although nothing extraordinary. 150610

Beer Store, Southampton: pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is dank hops with citrus, pine, and fleurs. Taste sis rather bitter but in a manageable and not too brutal way. Nice and a bit sweet. Amazing aftertaste. Basically, the moment that you smell it, you know this is next level shit.
Growler thanks to Steve. Pours out a cloudy golden topped with a white head. Nose is nice crisp hops citrus pine caramel malts. Taste is more of the caramel malt sweetness a nice hop mix. Very nice.

75cl growler courtesy of Dfroms, thanks Dan for bringing this to Belgium.
Dorée sur un léger orangé trouble, col est épais crémeux blanc voire blanc-cassé.
Arôme offre un bouquet très plaisant au niveau des houblons, retrouve des effluves fruitées alternant vers le pamplemousse, touche de tropical et autres agrumes, le tout semble renforcé par un rétro de pin finement résineux.
Palais met bien en avant un caractère résineux qui est juste phénoménal. Pin avec une petite pointe dalcool malgré les 7.6%. Herbacé avec une note finement aigrelette de pamplemousse, sec en fin de bouche, herbacé, pointe épicé et un malté restant plus en retrait.
Thanks to Bytemesis, this bottle poured cloudy lemon yellow with a thin white head and lacing. Aromas of citrus, grapefruit, floral, and toast. Flavor is mildly bitter. Tasty.

On tap at Mad Taco. Originally reviewed 7/16/2013.

Hazy yellowish orange. Nice white head. Good lacing.

 Bright orange hop aroma. Slightly sweet. Some grapefruit. Grainy.

Lots of citrus hop flavor. Reminds me a lot of Heady Topper. Orange and some grapefruit. Grainy texture throughout with less sweetness than I expected given the nose. A bit of bitterness in the finish.

A little on the heavy side. Medium carbonationand a bit creamy.

My favorite in the series thus far.

Fresh growler. The subdued nose features mild hay, pine and floral hints with a spicy hint nearly hidden beneath. Semi-occluded light lemon color. Juicy tangerine bites initially on the taste with pine resin, mild alfalfa and a strong grapefruit juice bitterness to close. The bitterness is quite assertive but the juiciness evens it out. A delicious DIPA.
Hazy gold pour, big white head. Aroma of hay, manure, subtly sweet and fruity. Flavor of pineapple, grass, resin... long dry bitter finish. Super bitter.

Draft at W.o.Rs. Poured a slightly cloudy dirty straw gold with a dense white head. Aroma is dank hop resin, cat piss, dry citrus. Flavor is similar but a step up, awesome actually, notes of dank hops, light weed, rotting citrus, cat piss and tropical fruit. Awesome beer.

Draft at Hill Farmstead. Pours a nice yellow light orange color with an off white head. Aroma is a bit more mild, but could be because I had Abner right before. Nice juicy fleshy fruit hop flavor. Excellent body without any bitterness bite. Very well done.

Growler received in trade. Pours very hazy orangish yellow with a rather big frothy white head that leaves some thick sticky lacing in the glass while dissipating. Smell I fruity with crackers, white bread, grapefruit juice, pink grapefruit juice, kumquats, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals, bergamot and lemon zest. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter and fruity. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny astringent, very tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with crackers, white bread, several different kinds of grapefruit, star fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles and lemon zest. Mouth-smacking grapefruit goodness. Clean and great! Yummy!

(Bottle) Pours hazy orange golden with an off-white head. The aroma holds boat loads of spicy grapefruit with undertones of resinous wood and a touch of tropical fruits. Tight cracker-like malt, some bread. The flavour is dry, medium to heavily bitter with a light to medium acidic profile. Mostly grapefruit and cracker-light malt. The mouthfeel is tight but soft with a medium carbonation. Lingering grapefruit taste. Medium bodied.
Growler tnx to Alex. Pours cloudy amber with a nice off white head. Aroma is citric grapefruit fruity dry spicy grainy. Flavor is fruity citric grapefruit slightly malty dry, very nice.

750ml 3 days old growler from the brewery shared with Ben and Mathieu. Aroma: loads of grapefruits, floral and a tiny bit piney. App: hazy straw almost golden, small white head and little lacing. Medium body, fluffy, fruity, clean dry bitter finish. Overall: great! Wish I drank it earlier though. But great dry clean bitter finish.

Growler from the brewery. Shared with my buddy Jay, on his last day at Beer Run. Happy trails! Hazy orange, large creamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of resin and grapefruit. The taste is tropical fruits, lime, mango, grapefruit. Medium bodied, well balanced.

On tap at The Reservoir, Waterbury, VT.
At least this was poured into closest respected/correct glassware, a snifter.
The appearance was a moderately hazy burnt orange color with a bar pours kind of slim looking film of a white head. Barely any lacing.
The smell had a sweet pulpy grapefruit bursting over some bitter pine and subtle lemon rind.
The taste takes the previously mentioned flavors and adds a nice drying effect on into the aftertaste and finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a good sipping quality about it. Carbonation seemed good with enough harsh bitterness on my tongue to definitely show some great DIPA effects.
Overall, this was a very nice DIPA that I would have again.

Hazy golden yellow, small white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical fruit, hay. Medium body, prickly mouthfeel. Minimal alcohol. Nice crisp bitterness, some malt but not much, grassy, flowery, spicy flavors with some grapefruit, not powerful or anything but very nice.

Growler - pours a cloudy yellow. Lots of grapefruit, oranges and lemons in the nose. Taste is bitter up front with some pungent grapefruits, lemons, oranges, and tangerines. Very well balanced to the end.

On tap. Pours a hazy amber with moderate head. Aromas of tropical fruit, grapefruit, toasted malts and a hint of garlic. Flavors of sweetened grapefruit, dough, light pine and limes. Big body. Bitter finish.

Sample at the Northeastern Brewery (VT) Tasting on 08/16/2015. The beer is a cloudy orange color with a medium off-white head that diminishes steadily to a film. The aroma consists of tropical fruit, piney hops and malt. Medium body with flavors of pineapple, melon, resiny hops and malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a lingering fruity hops aftertaste. Very good beer all around.
Tap. Hazy orange yellow pour with a nice white foamy head. Citrus, pine, resin, grapefruit. Big body but smooth with a very long and favorable finish. Very complex. Refreshing yet complex. Very nice

Draught at Armbsy Abbey, 8/16/15.Not quite the usual appearance of most Hill Farmsteads. Still looks good, but the haziness is stronger and the head retention/size a little weaker.But as far as the rest of the beer, Shawns done it again...What a subtle, reserved, delicious, drinkable beer. The aroma shows light candied orange peel, lemon zest, a touch of pine underneath and vibrant lime juice notes. Malt is well-attenuated and adds only a touch of honey/bread dough. No alcohol or flaw.The texture is felt first; soft, but with a subtly tight, engaging carbonation. A bit of bitterness emerges, with light lime, white grapefruit and sweet orange all balancing each other. Interesting notes of rose petal, lilac and lemon zest, with dry pine on the finish, showing no resin or acidity whatsoever. Clean, wonderfully characterful yeast and light minerality. Hard to describe why its so enjoyable. The reserved nature is a lot of it, for me. Much like Legitimacy, it isnt flashy or anywhere near overdone. Not a "big" beer, which is great. Had a full glass, but demands more. A very thoughtfully done beer!

Growler de 2 litres partagé avec Mademoiselle Irina et Catalin. Bière bien orangée, trouble et flamboyante à tous les niveaux, coiffée dune mousse blanche bien collante et déstructurée à la belge. Les arômes sont très fruités et tropicaux dagrumes tels lorange, le citron vert et le pamplemousse rose. Nos voisins à la table da côté y décelaient même de la soupe de poisson...? En bouche le liquide présente des saveurs semblables aux arômes avec cependant une trop grande quantité de sucre à mon goût personnel. Le liquide est riche, plutôt collant et bouratif, mais comme tous les produits de HF, combien plaisant à boire!

Robe jaune foncée assez trouble. Épais col de mousse blanc qui disparaît tranquillement. Dentelle mince mais collante. Arômes de pamplemousse, notes florales, zeste dorange, pin. Semble plutôt sèche et franche. En bouche, pamplemousse, orange, résine de pin assez prononcée. En général, cest du houblon aux saveurs de pamplemousse très amer. Finale un peu florale et de grains maltés. Texture mince et moyennement sèche, corps moyen.
Bottle at MrOrla and ShaunHill reconnects. Hazy yellow body with a medium body. Hops, grapefruit, citric, grass, herbs, medium bitterness. Great.
Pours a hazy pale yellow with a white lacing. The aroma is dank nelson hops, earth, grass and citrus. Flavor is moderately bitter and rather juicy.amazing

Bottle generously shared by Phil at Meridian Pint during DC Beer Week, thank you sir! Hazy yellow color, white head with curtain lacing. Aroma of mango, pineapple, orange, light grapefruit. Taste has softly bitter grapefruit and mixed tropical fruit. Perfect balance and soooo easy to drink. Probably the most easy drinking DIPA Ive had. Amazing.

A hazed golden ale with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet fruity caramel malt with smooth floral hops, resinous and piney, very nice. In aroma, sweet fruity caramel malt with light citrus floral hops, grapefruit pulp, nice and smooth. On tap at Hen of the woods.

Draft at three penny. Poured cloudy and orange with a foamy white head. Aromas of tons of tropical and citrus fruit with resin. Flavor of peach, mango, grapefruit, and orange. Really good. Medium body and sticky texture. Carbonation was good and a smooth finish with a bit of dryness. Amazing.
Pours hazy. Aroma of peach, grapefruit and resin, light lemon, very straight up citrus. Taste is lightly earthy with some resin inputs, very easy going and drinkable, ever so lightly tart.

Tasted from draft. Pours a super cloudy pale orange with thick white head. Tons of lacing. Aroma is big time tropical fruit. Notes of mango, passion fruit, pineapple and orange. Taste is incredibly well balanced. Mild to moderate bitterness with malt backbone. Really no bitter bite at all. I really think non IPA drinkers would love it. Creamy and smooth mouthfeel with no hint of alcohol. Flavors of oranges, grapefruit, passion fruit, mango, pine, biscuit sweetness. Incredible IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Swing-top growler from Greg. What an awesome surprise! Cloudy pale orange with white froth. Nose is orange, pine and grass with hints of cat. Medium body, resiny with a soft tingle. Taste is citrus peel, toffee, grapefruit, funky pine and lemon candies. Rindy goodness.

(750ml growler) cloudy bright gold, thick white head, looks perfect. Nose is mosaic, blueberries, citrus peel, oranges, lemons, hoppy. Taste of citrus peel, orange zest, citrus oil, medium bitterness, delicious. Perfectly bitter linger

Draught @ Hill Farmstead Brewery, Greensboro, VT
Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape, grass, hint of caramel and alcohol. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long malty, citrus, grape and piney finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2015 Growler from the brewery. Pours cloudy yellow with a big creamy white head that just sticks all over the glass. Aroma of grapefruits, pineapples, mangoes, some pine and grass, really nice. Flavor is off the hook. Lots of bitterness here, but it gets your palate ready for the sweet pineapple and mango, along with lots of citrus fruits, and then a final kick of bitter dry pine. Finishes clean as can be (no surprise there for HF). Body is relatively light for a DIPA, but creamy with nice sweet malt backing. Goes down way too easy. This is fantastic.
Drank during the tasting 08-05. Rich beer. Good blond one. Above average. Hop is present.

Growler at home. Apperance is hazy yellow with a small head. Aroma is citurs, Grape, hops. lots of tropical fruit. Taste is crisp bitterness, citrus, a bit malty, but still a very good feel. Unfortounly the growler had popped, but this was still amazing. very light carbonation due to the popping..
Tasted from growler. Poured a cloudy golden color with a smaller sized head. Tropical fruits, citrus, grapefruits, with some pine. Lighter malt balance in the tastes.

Growler from tom10101 shared with my wife, thanks a ton man! Apperance is cloudy yellow with nice white head. Aroma is citurs, pineapple, lots of tropical fruit. Taste is crisp bitterness, lemon zesty, grapefruit, pineapple, with a juicy finsih. Wonderful mouthfeel, lots of carbonation. Man, this is really really good, excellent balance with very little sweetness, and lots of grapefruit and citrus flavour. Delcious stuff.

Sampled at the brewery and rated from a 2L growler. Oddly enough seemed to benefit from sitting in the growler for a while as I was not originally too impressed by the sampler. Hazy dark amber with an off white head. Old lemon and grapefruit rind, mango, some papaya, some peach and semi-floral hops with a background malt presence. Moderate carbonation and full body, crisp, balanced, easy to drink and enjoyable with a refreshing bitterness.

750ml growler. Hazed straw golden with ample head and spotty lacing. Super balanced nose of creamy pils malt, citrus and sweet piney hops. Creamy mouth feel. Light sweetness up front, citrus, pine, pith...super balanced.
Growler, pour is golden with medium head. Aroma is big tropical fruit, citrus, and pine. Taste is fruity and bitter with a smooth finish, a touch of alcohol

UPDATED: APR 15, 2015 Hazy orange color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, citrus, tangerine, toast, pine and some tropical fruits. Taste of citrus, pine, resin, tropical fruits, juicy, sweeter grapefruit. Bitter, hop finish.

Pouts a hazed peach juice color with a decent white head. Aromas of of tropical fruits, guava, mango. Citrus. Taste is lightly bitter and semi sweet. Flavors of juicy tropical fruit, chewy lemon rind. Very good. Tasted side by side with Heady and this was a touch behind.  
http://i.imgur.com/B4PKMD8.png

Tap @ Worthy Burger. This is a damn near perfect DIPA. Hill killed it on this experiment. Grapefruit galore as the citrus poors out from the glass but yet so balanced with the hops mixture making this so enjoyable to drink. I just have to give this a "hells yeah" to try if you can locate somewhere.

Growler shared thanks to scotchzi! Pours a hazy golden yellow with thin bubbly head. Aroma and taste are big on simcoe and mosaic, zesty grapefruit and earth, nice balance of malt and hop profile. Darn tasty IPA.
750 ml bottle shared by Timfoolery, lots of grapefruit aroma and flavor, slight bitterness an the end.
Growler - Bright grassy hops, little cat pee and a hay. Cloudy gold with a light white head. Lots of hay and grass with a light bitterness. Nice, but not as nice as others seem to think.
Pours rather unclear yellow , small to no white head . Smell is fruity, peach, Nelson hops , bit pine . Taste is bit bitter , floral , nelson, citra, pine and mango . Very nice .

On tap at Hill Farmstead. Wow! I dont even know what to say! This was so well balanced. Nice soft nose of peach, grapefruit, light sweet malt and an slight floral note. Taste follows the nose. Harmony of grapefruit bite with soft peach sweetness. Floral notes combine with herbal notes to make a moderate bitterness to the finish. Crisp and clean like all the other HF pale ales. Awesome!

Backlog rating. Growler at the Chrisos May tasting, London. Huge thanks to Leighton for the awsome treat! It pours a rich orange color with a large white head. Aroma is fresh, fruity, juicy, dank, with notes of melon, mango, grass, citrus peel, grapefruit, light caramel, weed. Taste is again quite sweet but well balanced, danky, grassy, citrusy, balanced, intense, fresh. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, standout beer by a mile

Bottle shared at Chrissos May 2014 tasting 25/05/2014. Big thanks to Leighton! Aroma is composed of nicely layered hops, piney, spicy lemon with tropical fruits thrown in of mellon anf lychee. Hazed golden yellow pour. Flavour is lemon, pine, lychee. Many layered hop flavours. Really nice. Assertive clean hop bitterness. Tasty beer.
Un growler 8,4%. Un robe jaune avec un nez superbe dagrumes. Une bouche facile, rafraichissante, longue et savoureuse. Difficile de faire mieux dans le genre. Des pamplemousses..cest bon.

Version à 8.4%. Doré est ce liquide qui sort tout droit dune bouteille de 75 cl. Magnifique tête blanche qui s essouffle trop rapidement. Nez de pamplemousse et de houblons encore bien verts et herbacés avec un soupçon de vanille et une levure funky. Goût de pamplemousses juteux. Cest impressionnant. Alcool imperceptible. Corps sculpté pour les grandes soifs. Finale amère dagrumes blancs avec une pointe sucrée semblable à un ananas bien mûr. Si facile à boire.

Growler courtesy of Kermis. Poured a hazy light amber with a thin white head. The aroma is massive grassy hop, grapefruit citrus yeast. The flavour is light bitter sweet with a rich fruity yest fresh grass hop, light toothpaste palate. Medium to light bodied with average carbonation. A real treat.

Growler shared. Pours cloudy golden with a cream off white head. Aroma of strong citra and pineapple in the forefront, with orange peel, resinous hops, grapefruit and a light nice caramel malt hiding in there. Flavor is over light sweet and heavy bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Lovely stuff!

growler courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
Thin creamy white head. Very hazy golden blond pour. Lovely citrus aroma. Very well balanced. Lovely grapefruit bitterness. Very well done

Orange pour, creamy white head. Nose is big pineapple, fresh water, grapefruit, minerals. Taste is big pineapple, so clean and fresh, minerals, floral hops. Palate is so crisp and clean, nice sticky body. The best IIPA Ive had besides maybe Abner.

750 ml fill bottle purchase by LadySusan at the brewery on August 21, 2014. Yellow cream, medium head. Green hoppy aroma, notes of grapefruit zest. Mineral grapefruit taste, dry hoppiness, nice bitterness. Better than Mambo #5, Five Alive and Channel #5 combine!

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2014 750 ml growler (Best consumed by AUG 30 2014) thanks to BoBoChamp! Pours cloudy orangeish with a white head. Aroma is very pleasant, mostly on grapefruit and orange but also some passion fruit, pine resin and it is a little dank as well. Flavour is quite the same. Tons of grapefruit, spruce and resin and some tropical character. Light grassiness.  Finishes with quite some bitterness and noticeable hop oils. Overall the beer is very citrus-fruity. Body is medium. Silky mouthfeel. Very solid indeed!
Growler. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose/taste of hop, resin, caramel malt, grapefruit, tropical citrus and grass. Medium body.

750 ml swing-top growler, best by 8/22/14, consumed on 8/18/14. Plenty of clearance. Pours a hazed pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical fruits (lemon, lime, grapefruit, melon), grass, straw, husk, crackers. The flavor follows the same lines. So light and clean, dry, fresh - and refreshing. Man, this is lovely on the palate, even if the flavor profile is slightly restrained in comparison to the nose. Smooth, tasty, and drinks like a light, hoppy APA.

Hazy gold pour, 1 finger head. Big tropical frit aroma and flavours. Mango, grapefruit, pineapple. Smewhat dank. Crackery malt backbone. Medium body. Im doing it no justice whatsoever. One of the best double ipa ive ever had.

750ml swing-top, thanks to phaleslu for sharing. Best consumed by 8/22/14. Hazy golden orange color. Totally hazy. Thin ring of white head. Leaves some kinda loose bits of lace. Awesome big zesty grassy grapefruit kind of lime. Flavor is an explosion of tropical flavors, pretty impressive. Not as bitter as most hop forward beers, the aroma of the hop shines, rather than this just being extremely bitter. Not as assertive, good balance to this, really impressive hop aroma. Grapefruit. So impressively clean. Just a mild plain crackery malt. Moderate bitter taste, but not bothersome at all. Like the opposite of astringent. Mild to moderate sweet. Medium-plus body, lighter than the ABV would suggest. Could be like a bigger bodied pale ale. Super smooth, lighter carbonation. Super easy drinking, refreshing, bright DIPA. Fantastic stuff. I usually raise an eyebrow at HF hype. But this one is bonafide outstanding.

Draft. Pours murky orange with a thin white head that lingers. Strong intoxicating cities aroma over light carbonation. Superior complexity in a first class double. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Blonde voilé. Léger collet blanc. Nez: Fruit tropicaux. Ananas. Mangue. Pamplemousse. Sapin. Bouche: Un peu sucré. Fine chaleur d'alcool. Fruité. Mangue. Bien houblonné. Ananas. Très bien.

Growler shared by Kyle! Pours a hazy pale gold with a white head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has a sweet citrus note with a bit of bitterness with a light sweet grain backbone. Flavor has a bit more bitter citrus with some sweetness and a light sweet grain backbone.

Medium sized, fluffy white head that really lasts, lacing is thick, coating and lasting.Seriously murky, blond in color. Citrusy, resiny, piney nose, lightly earthy and somewhat dank. Med/full body, velvety on the tongue with a really soft carbonation, juicy and fat, mouthwatering. Danky, green hop flavors, largely citrus with notes of pineapple juice and some burnt wiring, hint tropical and spicy. Dry finish with a lighter than expected bite, some stone fruit notes. Just juicy goodness, fresh. Props to WillRunForBeer for the growler, awesome! Thanks again Brian!

Pours hazy and like grapefruit juice. Yellow and with a thin white head of foam that fell pretty fast. Leaves some lace. Nose is citrus! Orange, grapefruit and a little sweet grass. The malt peeks its head out with a touch of sweetness on the nose. It drinks lovely. Not a hint of alcohol on the palate. Just beautiful citrus. sweet orange, sweet earth, a touch fo grapefruit and some grass. Finishes with a perfect bitter that does not reside too long and that reminds you to take one last notice of all that fruit. Malt is a bit of weight on the palate but has a sweetness that seems to come out of no where and so delicately. Drinks clear and fruity and finishes dry but with a bit of tartness to keep your mouth watering long into the finish.

Another fabulous beer from Hill Farmstead.
Bottle @ Chriso May 14 tasting. Pours hazy pale gold, fruity aroma with a resinous hoppy double IPA character, fresh with zesty citrus and hoppy grapefruit bitterness. Tasty.
Tap at the brewery. Pale yellow and cloudy with a nice white head. Citrus hoppy nose. Really nice taste, lots of balance and great mouthfeel. Citrus really comes through.
Chriso May 2014 tasting. Pale gold hazy. Lasting white head. big fresh hoppy. grapefruit. So its good. Fresh hoppy. Lovely. Good bitterness.

Growler drank one day after purchase. Pour a beautiful blond with a foamy white head. Aroma is very citrusy along with the usual Hill Farmstead dankness. Taste is grapefruit zest, some bready malts and a lingering resinous bitterness. Full bodied with lively carbonation. Another stellar hoppy beer from Hill Farmstead.
750 ml. growler. Thanks Kyle! Pours a hazy pale gold with a very nice white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, pine, floral, and tropical. Hard to beat this one!
750ml growler thanks to Brian drank on may 15th. pours a light gold with a large white head. floral grapefruit and pine taste.

Pours lemony white with a creamy white head. Aroma is a big lemony citrus sweet punch so pleasant with the preferred hops of US and. New Zealand. Flavor is similar bringing big citrus lemon hops, not zesty or overly sweet but so smooth and pleasant on the tongue.
From notes. Taster at the source. Pours pale white gold with a clingy white head. Aroma is floral, citrus. Flavor is soft, smooth citrus hop. Abv well hidden.

Growler thanks to Seth. Pours a cloudy orange gold with thick frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is a strong grapefruit and pine. Medium mouthfeel with clean sweet hop, light bitterness, so easy to drink. Really enjoyed this one.

29/IV/14 - 75cl growler bottle @ De Hopduvel - BB: IV/29/14 (2014-443) Thanks to AdamJackson and Bobochamp for sharing the bottle!
Pretty cloudy straw yellow beer, no noticeable head. Aroma: very fruity, piny and resinous hop aromas, citrus, pineapple, passion fruits, grapefruit. MF: soft carbon, full body. Taste: sweet and fruity start, lots of exotic fruits, passion fruits, very bitter resinous hops, lots of bitter grapefruit. Aftertaste: very piny, bitter, bit medicinal, lots of grapefruit, citrus, agrum fruits, dry medicinal bitter ending. Not my favourite kind of (i)ipa, too bitter and no sweet malt base to balance it out. Solid beer nevertheless.

Growler: Thanks, Max. Translucent, pale pear colored body; cloudy, & topped with a fuzzy, white, micro-bubbled head that quickly spreads to a chunky collar. Lightly dank, sticky hop oils crowd the aroma with an amazing, underlying fruit presence... Sticky, pungent passion fruit, juicy pineapple, mango, grapefruit, guava... Wow. I cant decide if its more tropical or citric. I think, tropical. But whatever, it smells fantastic. Hint of resin in the finish. Taste is so crisp & clean, lots of juicy passion fruit & grapefruit out of the gate - bitter, but not abrasively so. A good, weedy hop punch with that sticky, dank, resinous mid-palate that swings into a bitter, dry, clean finish littered with grapefruit rinds, orange peels, & lingering peach. Plain & simple, another fantastic IPA from Shaun, its not even fair.

750ml growler (6 days old) pours cloudy opaque pale orange-yellow with a finger of head. Nose is dank juicy grapefruit, pineapple, citrus, tropical fruit. Taste is incredibly soft mouthfeel, deep juicy dank tropcal fruit, grapefruit, pineapple, orange zest. Finish is balanced bitterness and tropical fruit juice which coats the palate and lingers pleasantly, touches of soft malt. Near perfect. Simply the best DIPA I have tried.

Thanks to tderoeck! Pours a hazy yellow orange color with a tight white cap. The smell is grapefruit and tropical fruit. The taste is red on grapefruit initially with some softer tropical fruit notes coming in later with a touch of honey sweetness, ending dry and somewhat bitter. On the light side of medium with the typical Hill Farmstead wonderfully fine, elegant carbonation. Great stuff!
Hazy yellow pour light head. Hay farm aroma. Light carb med bod. Bitter sweet malt hop finish. Its ok.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 On tap during DLD 2014. Pours a cloudy yellow orange with a white head. Aroma came across like a fart laden grapefruit at first. Kind of light on the hop aroma. The taste is light and on the bitter side of balanced. Not as amazing as people make it out to be. KingSue was the star of the show that day.

Growler 750ml. Couleur jaune-orangée trouble, mousse blanche aérienne laissant une dentelle éparse. Arôme dagrumes, pomélo, malt, pin, zeste de citron. Goût de pomélo, houblon résineux, zeste de pamplemousse, amertume moyenne-élevée, herbal en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen-dense, texture ample.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2014 75cl growler, fresh batch (best consumed by 8/30/2014), no mention of ABV, new exclusive American brew Anno 2012, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex bitter brew, fruity/bitter and slightly woody/floral, balanced, cloudy, rocky head, very good brew, yet expensive!
Draft. Light yellow pour with some scant head. Citrus, grapefruit, or grassy hop aromas. Flavor is milder than I thought it would be, floral, citrus and grassy flavors.

Pour is hazed golden yellow with an off white head. Nose is juicy, tropical fruit and citrus, a hint resiny and oily in back. Light grain profile up front and some malt sweetness to balance. Taste has more bitterness than I thought it would, lighter body and softer carbonation. The grain is soft up front, hop driven. Citrus, pine fades to a more leafy herbal note, a strong grapefruit bitterness lingers with a fairly dry finish.

Growler thanks to GT. Pours a glowing light gold color with medium sized white head. Can smell this from a mile away, big aromas of overripe grapefruit, mango, pineapple juice, slight hop spiciness, marshmallow. The palate is juicy with flavors of tropical fruits, round citrus, sweetness but not malt sweetness more of a fruit sugar sweetness. Still manages to be light on its feet, finishing clean with some leafy bitterness.

Growler. Pours a cloudy orangeish with a short lived white head. Aroma is fruits (oranges, grapefruits and other citrus). Flavor is fruits, yeast, tons of citrus, spruce and resin. Finish is hop oils, and tons of bitterness. Medium body, soft mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very solid.

750 ml growler shared by a local. Pours a hazy golden orange color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have a wonderful grapefruit citrus, some tropical fruits, dank hops, and some resin, not a bitterness monster, but very fruity and aromatic, juicy. Enough malt backbone to stand up to the hops. I still look forward to trying anything from these guys.

750 mL growler from Moy Emrick. The pour on this is a gorgeous orangey gold. A little foggy, with a nice white head that fades down to a film, leaving a beautiful lace around the entire barrel of the glass. The aroma is hop dominant and luscious. There is a fruity grapefruit presence and the IPA notes mesh greatly. The flavor is following in similar fashion. The middle of the body is a little sweet but very well mixed with fruitiness and dryness. The mouth feel is a little thin, and that's about all I can knock it on. Very good imperial IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Prohibition Pig: pours golden straw with a one finger white head. Aroma floral, tropical, citrus. Incredible hop flavor, tastes floral and pineapple. Full bodied, great mouthfeel, smooth finish with a lingering tropical flavor. Awesome beer.

Bottle. Growler. Pours hazy orange With a small creamy head. Really intense and juicy hop nose and flavor. Pine and grapefruit. Dry, slick, oily and power bitter. No sweet malts and no signs of yeast. Very clean. Yes - one of the Very Best 2ipas ive had! Bang!

Growler filled on Wednesday. Pours a cloudy and pale yellow with a thin white head that leaves nice lacing. Aroma of pine needles, citrus and weed. Taste is bitter with a little backing sweetness. Flavors of grapefruit rind and coniferous. Carbonation level is medium, mouthfeel a little juicy. As usual, HFS delivers a really great DIPA. This serie is absolutely stunning.

5th December 2013Craft Clerkenwell tasting. Thanks to Leighton for this evenings New England haul. Hazy gold beer, good white head. Palate is light and crisp. Light malt and malt cream. Light pine and good hop spice. Only a whisper of citrus. Light dry finish.

Bottle, big thanks to Leighton, split at CBC 05/12/13.
Hazed orange with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is dank hops, bitter orange, grapefruit, tropical dankathon, citric infused straw.
Taste comprises dank hoppage, dirty peach strain, orange pith, bitter grapefruit, straw, orange sherbet, tropical fruit tang.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, pith lead grassy closure with an assertive hop bitterness tang.
Solid DIPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 750 growler bottled saturday , huge thank to dany. Cloudy yellow orange. Huge grapefruit aroma and taste. Very smooth and paletable. Reminds me of permanent funeral and heady. Very good stuff.
Poured from growler. Cloudy light orange. Sweet orange/citrus nose. Great balance in citrus taste. Smooth and nice bitter back end.

Bottle cheers to the great bloke who is Leighton. Pours hazy orange with a small, very firm white head leaving great lacing. Nose is huge zest! Big citric zest with a touch of pepper and lemon. Grapefruit towards the end with pine and lime. Taste has juicy citrus with line leaves, pepper, straw, lemon rind and grapefruit. Bitter sweet stuff. Great beer

Suprême kiwi et chlorophylle dans une soupe hyper tropicale mais poivrée à la fois. Lamertume est celle dune cocotte fraîche et dun afflux dagrumes. Elle est définitivement spéciale mais pas au niveau de certaines autres de Shaun.

Served on-tap, reviewed from notes.


A - Pours a fuzzy peach color with a nice one and a half finger tall white head, dissipating down to a light film, leaving spotty trails of lace down the sides of the glass.


S - Smells of strong grapefruit pith, fresh cut grass, pale malt and a touch of sweetness. The fruit / grass combo is killer, makes this one a joy to smell.


T - Starts off with the intense fruitiness, mostly grapefruit and other citric rind, slowly giving way to the grassy hop bitterness, pine needles, pale malt and a touch of caramel sweetness. The balance of flavors is great yet intense, hard to pull off. Finish is pretty dry, lingering long after the finish.


M - Medium body with moderate carbonation. Fruity, bitter feel throughout with a but if dryness at the end of each sip.


O - Probably my favorite to date from the series. It has everything I look for in a DIPA yet it remains incredibly drinkable. Amazing work on this one Shaun.

Growler... Hazy yellow ale with a small, fat- bubbled, white head. The aroma points toward huge dry-hopping - armpit funk is joined by citrus fruits, tropical fruits and melons. Full-bodied with lively carbonation. The fruity, juicy, flavor leans just a hair toward the bitter side of balance. Bittersweet, tongue-numbing finish. Growler generously shared by ctipping!

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Thick White Head, Great Lacing

S: Mild Grapefruit, Mild Grapefruit Rind

T: Grapefruit, Mild Grainy

M: Great Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Bitter

Overall, good but disappointing for a DIPA.

Happy IPA day! I just got this in the mail today so I figured it would be a great time to drink up.
Poured into a HF becker glass.

A-Cloudy orange yellow color with a 2 finger fluffy white head. decent retention and amazing lacing. 

S-Grapefruit, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, some grassy notes, and a feint bready character on the back end. 

T- Huge hop aroma- more grapefruit and mango mixed with some grass and pine resin. This kind of tastes like Abner. There is a big bitter note mixed in with some caramel on the back end. No alcohol or other flaws that I can note. Very close to the perfect IPA in my opinion. 

M- Carbonated to the perfect level. You can barely notice it, indicating it is right where it should be. Dry, but not overly so. The long bitter finish encourages you to keep drinking.

O- Amazing beer. I think this is my favorite of the society series, and maybe of all the HF IPAs and pales I have had so far. Amazing hop flavor and aroma that smacks you in the face but doesnt overtake the malt balance whatsoever. I could drink a 2L growler of this by myself in a night easily, despite the alcohol. Cant wait to get more if/when it comes around again.

Big thanks to cfrancess33 for getting the growler to our tasting. 750 ml growler served in a HF wine glass.

A: Pours a hazy yellowish color with some orange-like hues dancing through out the body. A white head forms on the pour and recedes to a bubble ring. Some splotches of lace are left down the glass.

S: Lots of juicy citrus fruits going on with this one. Grapefruit, lemon rind and some lime zest as well. Tropical fruits as well with some pineapple. A little orange pith dryness and some sweet cracker malts.

T: The taste is much more vibrant the nose. Tons of grapefruit and tangerine notes. Incredibly juicy and citrusy. Lots of orange, mango and peach with some minimal resiny bitterness on the finish. Light sweet malt profile is present.

M: Light bodied with a perfect carbonation level. Smooth and sweet with a slightly bitter finish.

O: Very delicious. I could drink growler upon growler of this one. Great balance of flavors with a high drinkability.

Serving type: growler

07-16-2013
Growler. Pours a vibrant yellow light orange with solid white head. Big citrus and slight oak and butter aroma. Taste is juicy lots of nice nice fresh cut grass.

Growler. Pours hazy golden amber with a large white creamy head that slowly dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is quite pleasant, citrus, passionfruit, pine resin. Flavor is the same, light sweet and light bitter. The first sip had a strong burst of citrus, particularly oranges and overall the beer presented as very citrus-fruity. Medium body, characteristic smooth as silk mouthfeel. This was a very nice beer, even though I am guessing the growler had six weeks on it. Cant imagine how good this is fresh!
Growler from bytemesis, big thank you. Clear golden, light layer of foam, good lacing. Citrusy aroma, tropical fruit. Fairly malty body with a good bitter hop kick. Definitely one of the best.

Growler: &nbsp Amberish straw, slight haze, large pillowy white head, nice lacing. &nbsp Soft citrusy nose, a little grapefruit and floral notes. &nbsp Superbly smooth on the tongue. &nbsp Sweet resiny start, sweetened grapefruit, 

some floral notes. &nbsp Gotta say that this one just dances on the tongue! &nbsp Has a soft mountain shrubby backside, a little pithy with a touch of earthiness. &nbsp Good balance, sweet yet a little bitter. &nbsp Full bodied. &nbsp 

Sweet resiny finish. &nbsp Simply comes across as an extremely well made and very well balanced and clean example of an Imperial IPA. &nbsp Very very nice! &nbsp Thanks Scott for allowing me to try this!
growler at BCTC 2013. another amazing beer from HF. big bracing bitterness, grapefruit, pineapple. running out of superlatives

Growler shared by HopBear...thanks Barry! - Pours hazy yellow with a thin white head. Nose is dank garlic and onion hops, citrus and dry pale malt. Taste has lots of onion and garlic, with a bit of grassy hops and pale malt. The hops are the star here. Smooth and velvety with a medium-thin body. I like everything about this beer.

Growler shared by Phillycraft (thanks again). Aroma is passionfruit, papaya, mango, and a minerally malt. Pours apricot and hazy with a creamy film. Taste is super smooth with pineapple, papaya, fresh grapefruit and peach. Subtle notes all around with a great mature malty finish. Not overbearing and not sweet. Just perfection. Why cant anyone else replicate this kind of stuff near me?

Growler poured into a Hill Farmstead glass. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of citrus and grapefruit from the hops and fruit plus the light maltiness characteristic of this brewery. Flavor the same - amazing. Smooth texture. An amazing beer.

Growler shared by GT2 and shared at Congregation Azusa. Fully hazy golden pour with thick and creamy white foam. Aroma is a bit funky and pithy, tropical perhaps, and is mostly missing the nasty Nelson hops that I hate. Theres still a bit in there though. Taste is more of a fruity cocktail with alcohol thickness, mango smoothie, hefty sugar density. Rich palate..heavier than expected. Sugar, melon, and dank hops meld well. Overall refreshing beer despite the heavy sweetness.

Growler shared by GT. Thanks! Hazy pale golden pour with a white head. Really dank grapefruit, pineapple, tangerine, and pine hop aromas. A bit of orange zest and some dry, cracker malts. The flavor is really nice and fruity. A touch of sweetness in the form of orange and pineapple. Big grapefruit and tangerine, pine flavor and bitterness, and some cracker malt. A touch of grass on the finish. Really excellent, excellent stuff.

750mL flip-top growler thanks to jbeatty. 2-Day air mailed to me. Poured full haze glowing orange with rich, bright white foam. Good lacing. Nose is whipped cream, butterscotch, jackfruit, mango, and typical Nelson squashiness. Taste is richer than expected with whipped cream and heavy biscuit. Flashes of sugar and alcohol. Thick, dessert like finish. Saltwater, buoyant palate with a finale of grapefruit rind. Good, but not as bright and refreshing as Id like and nothing like the passionfruit smackdown of S&S#6.

Pour is hazy golden with white head and nice lacing. Aroma is amazing, strong grapefruits, loght tropical and piney notes. Taste is mostly grapefruits, light piney hops, moderate bitterness (for such a hoppy beer), light malts, dry finish. Medium body and medium to low carb. Very good!

Growler, 07/27/2013. Pours vibrant, cloudy orange, white head rests like a creamy pillow on the surface, sticky lacing left behind. Aroma is juicy grapefruit and pineapple, mango, orange essence, with earthy, lightly spiced pine, dusty pale malts behind. Taste is more grapefruit-centric with hefty citrus, still a bit of pineapple flesh, caramel sweetness blended in and offset by rich piney bitterness. Medium body, very easy to drink with bright well-balanced flavors and no sticky resin character. Great.

Growler, thanks to Colin. Cloudy orangish/yellow pour. White head. Pleasant grapefruit hop aromas. Great mouthfeel. Smooth grapefruit and citrus/orange peel hops blend seamlessly with the caramel malt notes. Really solid with a good body and great balance.

750 ml growler. Pours a cloudy yellow-orange color with a thick creamy head that fades very slowly and leaves some lacing. Very juicy and slightly musty hop aroma. Lots of grapefruit with pineapple, peaches, and flowers. Very nice juicy taste. Mostly grapefruit, which I love, but also some pine, peaches, flowers and some slight spicy/peppery hops too. Medium to thick body, creamy mouthfeel, very smooth. Another awesome IPA from HF. Thanks Tom!
Thanks to Andrew for this pour. Earthy pale malt aroma. New Zealand hops juicy fruity crisp. Light juicy bitter. Crisp good solid hops. Bitter awesome hop blend. This really grew on me. 9/4/8/4/17

En fût @ Farmhouse. Doré trouble avec des tons orangés, sans mousse persistante. Nez et bouche de pamplemousse blanc. La bouche nest pas dune intensité remarquable, mais on ne demande pas à ce quelle le soit; il ny a toutefois pas de creux, cest tout sauf mince. Cest habilement équilibré entre le malt et les agrumes (pamplemousse blanc, orange). Excellente!
Growler fill from the brewery. 2nd best IPA Ive ever had. Is it the well water or just a well balanced and hoptastic brew? Either way its mighty tasty. Cheers!

750ml growler. Huge thanks to Onebigtymer11. Pours a murky straw color with two fingers of fluffy white head. Lots of lacing. Aroma is "punch you in the face" grapefruit, some pineapple, peach, and just loads of sweet citrusy hops. Taste is again loads of grapefruit bitterness, notes of pineapple and other citrus fruits, some bready malt, grass, and some pine in the finish. Holy S$@# this is good!

Bright golden-orange body, medium sized white head, soapy lacing. Massive grapefruit presence supported by pine, orange and some tropical fruits. Medium bodied, assertive bitterness, clean finish, appropriately carbonated. Reminds me of fresh Blind Pig with some tropical notes

Sample at the brewery on 7/6/13. Clear orange in color with a medium white head. Malty and piney nose with grassy and spicy hop notes. Malty flavor with some onion and pine before a bitter grapefruit finish.

Hazy golden orange color, thin white head. Sugary tropical aroma of orange, grapefruit, peach, and mango. Mild sweetness followed by residual orange peel bitterness. Creamy, smooth, and crisp. Light- to medium-bodied, a pleasant bit of booziness, and refreshing

On tap. Pours a cloudy yellow amber. Very beautiful fruity aroma. Incredibly rich and smooth. Balance of hops and citrus. Awesome.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At the brewery October 2012

A- unfiltered opaque tangerine yellow with fair lacing and a finger of fluffy white head.

S - Big grapefruit.  Pine and some grass and a bit of soap.  Hints of orange and lemon as well with other less pronounced citrus and tropical fruits.

M- light, tart and effervescent with a light to medium body and medium palate.

T- more big grapefruit.  Kiwi, mango and honey in the middle with long but smooth finish of more juicy grapefruit.  Some resin and grass in the front as well.   Pretty smooth from front to back, consistent, with no real high highs and low lows in the taste curve.  Straight forward, but a good beer regardless.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Harvest festival and a week later in a 2L growler. Poured into HF taster again the classic Hill opaque yellow/orange in color with a healthy two finger white fluffy head. Heavy citrus scents, grapefruit and orange. Taste was mostly citrus, grapefruit. Had high expectations for this given how great #4 was. This was good, but didnt quite measure up to #4.

This poured a darker yellow color with an off white head.  The description certainly fits this one.  Straight grapefruit rind in the noze. very citrusy, light orange, showing light grain as well.  Flavor was fairly bitter grapefruit, but not mouth puckering, great feel on the mouth, not cloying, but refreshing.  One dimensional and interesting experiment, but not mind blowing like a few of their other IPA offerings.

On tap. Very hazy gold pour, almost white, white head. Aroma is really quite fruity and pungent, lots of grapefruit, the hops are wet and sticky. Taste is fruity, not particularly bitter, very grapefruity - bitter and citrusy tart at once. Alcohol is not perceptible. Palate is lightly-med carbed with med body. Not a huge fan of the Hill Farmstead Beers; however, I have to give them a B for effort.

In short: An intensely grapefruity/citrusy pale IPA.
How: Tap at brewery, Growlers at home.
The look: Cloudy pale blond body topped by a persistent small white head. 
In long: Nose is intensely grapefruity with some other citrusy and tropical fruits hiding in the back.  Taste has the typical pale IPA HF cushiony bready/crackery pale malts totally dominated by the intense fresh grapefruity/citrusy flavor.  No alcohol presence whatsoever.  When first released this beer was the closest thing Ive had to grapefruit juice from a beer.  I had another growler filled at the brewery one or two months later and it was a little less over-the-top grapefruity.  Still, I have a hard time believing that a beer can taste so much like fresh grapefruits without including a actual citrus fruits in the recipe.  When I had it on tap the first time at the brewery (one glass) I thought it was just about the best IPA ever brewed by HF, but after a few growlers I changed my mind, theres a sweetness sensation that piles up when drinking large quantities of this beer, something I never got from HF IPAs.  As excellent as HF IPA should be but a little less easy to drink a full growler than with their best offerings.  Im surprised at how much I have enjoyed the four Society & Solitude Ive had so far, I never had the #1 so I was afraid I wouldnt understand the #2 through #5.

On tap @ Three Penny Taproom. Murky golden orange with a medium sized white head. Danky hops, Citrus, grapefruit and resin play wonderfully in the nose. Flavors are all of the above with a pleasant bitterness and nicely balance with a malt finish. Awesome Beer!

Big thanks to Turd for sharing this one too! Another ass-rapingly good DIPA from HF, and on some level even better than the #3 that I was lucky enough to sample earlier in the year. Vibrant light golden pour, sprightly carbonation and a nice medium head. Very pert and citric nose, bright and dry for sure rather than the floral wonderment of other entries. Grassy, at times a bit spicy, like a cross between Sculpin and a dry imperial pils.

On-tap at Parker Pie and HF Harvest Fest 2012 into HF wine glass and pint glass (at Parker Pie).

Pours a mirky golden yellow color, white head, thin collar, spotty lace. Aroma is hop-forward without being over-the-hop, light fruity sweetness, some resin in there too. Flavor is grapefruit, pine, and citrus. Hoppy yet smooth...not a palate-wrecker...very well-done. Light toward medium body, good carbonation, oily hoppy finish.

Easier to drink then S&S #4 and I think I enjoyed this one a bit more as well. Very easy to drink for 7.8% and the perfect balance of hops to not kill me after one or two glasses. Great stuff!

Pour from a growler revealed a hazy golden color with plentiful white topping. Aromas as the beer warmed slightly were of full tropical notes of mango, pineapple, and yes grapefruit.  Characteristic smooth rich mouthfeel. Flavors amazingly complex of orange, lemon, and hoppy bitter goodness. Finish dry and long lasting flavor. Great beer for sure!

Bottle shared at CAH. Thanks, Cory. Pours a hazy golden yellow with white head that fades. nose is tropical fruits papaya and mango. first sipis juicy fruits, citurs hops like bergamon and cuquat. piney and grapefruit finish. amazing beer from shaun.

Draft at Craft Ale House Tuesday Night beer share.  Thanks, Cory.  Pours hazy golden with white lacy head.  Nose was tropical fruity hops, with grapefruit, mango, I even got some pear notes in this.  The flavor popped, with a nice tropical fruity semi-sweet hit of mango, pear, pineapple, and grapefruit, and resiny hops.  This one was complex as hell, nicely balanced, and the nose and flavor were juicy and popped, as I stated before.  This is yet another world class beer from Hill Farm.

Shared bottle at craft ale house. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. The aroma Is mostly pine but has some nice citrus notes. The taste is medium bitter with an amazing balance of sweetness. One of the best.
Cloudy yellow/gold pour. Pure grapefruit peel and grassy hops hit the nose followed by a light yeasty finish. Creamy, yeasty, hoppy, juicy, and utterly delicious. Wow.

Growler opened before thanksgiving dinner, shared with family.

If you like grapefruit you will love this beer.  Hazy straw color with a strong smell of grapefruit and tropical fruit.  Taste was strong grapefruit, to quote my wife" this tastes like grapefruit juice". Although i enjoyed it much more!

Flip top bottle from chouffe.  I opened this one up on Thanksgiving.  The pour is a hazy gold color with a white head that sticks around to shed some scattered lacing.  The aroma is a bit herbal and grassy with huge whiffs of tropical fruity hops.  Big juicy hop flavors of grapefruit, pineapple, and mango to mirror the aroma, with some sappy pine resin, and a bone dry finish.  The body is supportive but fairly light allowing this to go down incredibly easily with no unnecessary stickyness.  If theres such a thing as a sessionable IIPA this is it.  But make no mistake, this is loaded with delicious hops!  A near perfect IPA for my tastes, and to be honest, I cant think of how it could have been better.  Hill Farmstead does it again.

Growler at franks with Dallas, Vinny, bill, alan and frank. Pours a perfect golden hazy orange body with thick white lacing that lasts throughout. Aroma of fresh, tropical fruits.  Mouthfeel is perfect, refreshing and ultra sessionable with notes of funky citrus, pineapple, mango, light funk, light grapefruit and orange. Awesome. One of the best IPAs Ive ever had.
Growler. Pours a perfect gold. The best ipa nose ever. Perfect dry taste. Sweet, tropical. Insane.

Aroma: lots of juicy grapefruit and tropical fruit, floral hops, some resin and pine.  Some light malts, toast, and honey linger in the background.  Pours a hazy straw/yellow color, white head with good retention and lacing.  Amazing hop profile - tons of citrus, mango, and some pineapple.  Sticky resin and some orange as well, and a pleasant malt presence backing up the hops.  Just enough cereal grains and a touch of honey to slightly tame the hops.  Bitterness is medium-high, but well controlled and no astringent finish.  Light-medium body, medium carbonation, smooth and dry finish.  Wow, an excellent brew!
750 flip top growler thanks to time4lunch. Lovely yellow pour. Big hop aroma. Grapefruit mixed with tropical fruit. Amazing dry finish. Fantastic.

750ml growler. Gusher form the growler. It pours with a strudy white head and is a slightly hazy gold. HEad slowly recedes to come nice alcing. Smell is fresh hop-y. Grapefruit, hop cones, and grassiness in the aroma. The flavor is smooth and grapefruity. Medium to low bitterness. Nice fruitiness, awesome beer.

10-11-12 On tap: Jaune pâle, presque blanc (ressemble a une wit), trouble, sans effervescence et mince collet de mousse blanche. Légers aromes de houblon et dananas. Bonne amertume, douce en bouche avec des notes de fruits genre ananas. Coprs léger, veloutée.

Super Fresh Growler pour from my man Frank. Huge thanks for letting me try this absolutely insane ipa. Pours an ultra murked out yellow gold color with small snow white head and nice occasional lace patterns. Aromas of the juciest and most resinous hop flowers imaginable, tons and tons of grapefruit guts, pineapple, light tang, lemon fuel, mango. There has to be some riwaka or motueka in here, dont get quite the amount of cheese from nelson. Taste is the same as the aroma, and maybe more impressive. Perfectly dry and bitter in the close. Epic!

Verres, à la brasserie et au Black Back Pub. Arômes houblonnés, très frais, fruités, et intenses. Robe blonde, légèrement trouble, effervescence moyenne et légère dentelle. Très fraîche en bouche, le côté fruité montre un caractère très Néo-Zélandais, avec beaucoup de fruits tropicaux et dagrumes. La base maltée soutient le houblonnage, sans prendre trop de place. Finale sèche et moyennement amère. Une autre très belle double IPA de Hill Farmstead.

Growler sample via and shared with oakbluff. Greenish gold in colour with a significant amount of haze. Aromas are of kumquat, mango, herbs, and a hint of spice. Flavors are of fresh juice oranges, wood (but not pine), and more exotic citrus. Medium bodied with firm bitterness. Super citrusy hop vehicle. Another great IIPA from Hill Farmstead.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2013 Thanks a ton Joe for the HF hook up! Pour from a 750ml growler into a tulip glass. This was filled October 2nd, 2012.

A - Pours a very cloudy and light yellow body. Never seen a DIPA so light, it almost looks like a murky berliner weisse or something. Massive white head forms with just an unreal amount of sticky lacing and retention. Looks perfect.

S - Mango and grapefruit juice. The smell is just so oily and juicy with a touch of dankness on the very end. One of the best hop aromas I have ever smelled. I typically lean towards grapefruit and tropical notes over the dank/resinous/piney beers so this is just right up my alley.

T - Bitter grapefruit and mango juice. Like drinking a glass of oily and super fresh citrus juice. The taste is just so perfect. Bitterness is intense but never overwhelming and the juicy citrus finishes dry and pleasantly. Again, perfect.

M - Medium bodied with light and prickly carbonation. Highly drinkable.

O - Heady? This just replaced that beer as my favorite DIPA. This is just too stupidly perfect. I could drink this every day and never lust after another beer.

Growler from imstilltheGman... Murkey, cloudy pour.....looks like a wheat ale???? Small head that faded quickly. Nose of grapefruit.... Taste is fruity... tons of grapefruit. Kind of one dimensional. But still not bad. Medium to full body...Alcohol is hidden well.. Super smooth.... Overall: Good stuff

Bottle share w Aaron and Armin. + thanks greatly to Steve for bringing this beauty (plus many others) Poured a pilsner yellow with a fluffy white head. Nice citrus and tropical fruit aroma. Resin, sweet bready yeast and grapefruit / tangerine flavors jump out at you. Mouthwatering and slightly tart on the finish. A world class brew..

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2013 On tap at BLack Back.
Appearance : Hazy pale yellow with medium foamy white head.

Aroma : Sharp floral and citrusy hops. Light malt, light passion fruits. some yeast.

Taste : Rich citrusy and floral hops. Leafy and really floral. Sharp and pungent finish with light yeast. quite bitter. Light cat litter and some comfit lemon zest.

Overall : Really nice, great floral and leafy hops. Nice sharpness. Felt a bit lighter than Ephraim. Pretty much along the lines of HFB hoppy beers... not much more to say. Rating October 31st 2012. 8,3,8,3,17;3.9
750ml growler from HFB. 2 weeks old..
Appearance : Clear pale yellow med foamy white head,

Aroma : Big grassy, resinous and piny hops. Juicy citrusy notes. Light floral with a fairly present malty backbone.

Taste : Juicy and piny hops. Moderate resious notes with a rather present malty body. Finish is malty with resinous and piny hops. Light alcohol bite and/or spicy hops warmth.

Overall : Nice DIPA. Not necessarily my type. A bit too rough on the resinous/piny notes. Malt background is really nice. Nothing bad, very well executed and balanced just not really my favorite DIPA profile. Rating stays the same.
fresh growler at Harvest Fest... another outstanding Hill brew, tons of fresh citrus notes, huge thirst quencher

Growler shared by Kan and Drew. Thanks, dudes! Pours a richer hazy dulled golden dulled hue. Good frothy white head, laces well as a thicker film, laces ok. Aromas are richer dry bitter hops, lemons and grapefruit, with grass and florals. Richer dry hops, dry and bitter, soap and grass. Initial is mellow, a lighter body with richer dry earth and florals. Nice lemons, grass, richer dryness and light body. Touches of bread, grain, and mellow dryness. Middle is dry and richer citrus, fruit, hop flavor. Some touches of dryness grow, richer bitter hops. Some mellow grain, dryness, good session. Rich dry bitter hops, good flavor with lemon, grass and florals. Grapefruit, touches of melon. Richer dry, not overly hoppy but well done with a small malt body. Tasty and fresh. Thanks, guys!

Highly herbal, spicy aroma of lemongrass and ginger surrounded in citrus oils.  Its pungent and interesting.  Consistently, theres an unexpected alcohol coloring, though its not hot in the least.

Flavor has hay, flowers, and tons of citrus, grapefruit.  As is typical of this brewerys takes on the style, this is light on resin and bitter attack, and heavy on herbs, flowers, fruits; on the lighter side, but boldly showcasing its hop foundation.

Slick, medium to heavy palate; finishes with lots of pith and a sweet, floral honey texture.  Its initial curiosities didnt really take off into something memorable, but it was great nonetheless.

Growler thanks to Adam in recent trade, thank you!  Pour is unique. Very cloudy and very light yellow with a large white head. Aroma and flavor are straight forward and aggressive. Tons of pineapple and citrus hops. Certainly grapfruit is present, but I got a bit more pineapple than anything. Not too much malt here. Also a touch of spice on the back end. This is sticky. This is great overall. I cant quite explain it, but I fell like it was almost a little restrained. Its huge and delicious, but I feel like it was one step away from perfection. Maybe just a touch more sweetness. I think Im getting picky, this is outstanding!

My Bottom Line :  
Boastful citrus fruit, from grapefruit to starfruit, dominate this Double IPAs aroma and flavor profile, as sand-y allusions (cat litter?) and green resins slowly rise in the second half.

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A slice of foam covers the cloudy pale straw.
-The soft effervescence makes the citrus flavors feel even more juicier.
-Alcohol is a no show, which is great.
-I can easily see someone find this tiring if citrus is not a favorite flavor.

On tap at Blackback Pub, in Waterbury.

Growler: The aroma consists of big grapefruit and lighter tropical fruits. It pours a hazy/cloudy dull orange with a soapy white head that leaves some nice webbing on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with a quick dose of tropical fruits and a touch of pineapple. The finish has moderate-heavy grapefruit. Its light bodied with moderate carbonation.
Pale yellow appearance.  Grapefruity, floral aroma. Somewhat floral flavor, heavy on the hops but not too bitter. A well-rounded IPA.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2012 Growler at Dans shared with friends. Thanks again for this one Adam! Pour is hazy honey with a big white head and great lacing. Big grapefruit, kiwi, mango, tangerine, light grass, and orange peel in the aroma. Like a fresh squeezed tropical smoothie. Taste is sweet upfront with notes of pineapple, tangerine, mango, passion fruit, and grapefruit with a medium bitter finish. Medium body with fizzy carbonation.
